name: dplyr

## Special operator

- `%>%`
  * from the `dplyr` package
  * works like a pipe

--

```{r}
read.table("data/count_raw.txt", header = T, row.names = 1, sep = "\t") %>%
  head(6) 
```

---
name: dplyr-2

## Special operator

- `%>%`
  * from the `dplyr` package
  * works like a pipe


```{r}
read.table("data/count_raw.txt", header = T, row.names = 1, sep = "\t") %>%
  head(6) %>%
  rownames_to_column(var = "Gene")
```

---
name: dplyr-3

## Special operator

- `%>%`
  * from the `dplyr` package
  * works like a pipe

```{r}
read.table("data/count_raw.txt", header = T, row.names = 1, sep = "\t") %>%
  head(1) %>%
  rownames_to_column(var = "Gene") %>%
  gather(Sample_ID, count, -Gene)
```

* `gather()`
